page.title: 19SEASONAL WORK ON THE FARM
page.content: The seasonal programme for the farmer begins with ploughing, normally done between January and April. Some ploughing, however, occurs as early as November to expose the bare earth to the winter weather. Muck spreading follows and then harrowing, seeding and rolling are done in March or April. Crop spraying follows in May or June. Silage is taken in June and hay usually in July, although haymaking can occur a little earlier if the weather is particularly fine.Cereals are harvested in August or September,root crops in October. A variety of chemicals_nitrogen, phosphates, lime etc_are added to the soil, and chemical sprays are used to suppress weeds, mildew and insect pests.
